isis.stitle: 7.3 Liter Diesel Engine Service (1991) - CYLINDER HEAD AND VALVES - CYLINDER HEAD (Removal & Reassembly) - CYLINDER HEAD INSPECTION

step1.para: Using an outside micrometer, measure cylinder head thickness at four locations. If minimum specification is not met, replace the head.
Inspect the cylinder head as follows:

step2.para: Examine the cylinder heads visually for cracks using dye penetrant (spray dye) check methods.

note.para: Spray dye will expose hair line cracks or sand holes. Replace cylinder head if cracks are found.

step2.para:
Visually inspect combustion chamber inserts for cracking beyond the " FIRE RING". Refer to Figure 3.25
for pre-combustion chamber cracking criteria.
Visually inspect gasket and sealing surfaces for scratches or marks which may cause leakage after assembly.

Using a straightedge and feeler gauge, check the cylinder head gasket surface for warpage utilizing the checking pattern shown in Figure 3.16
. Replace cylinder head if beyond specified limits (see SPECIFICATIONS).

note.para: Prior to checking cylinder head gasket surface for warpage, remove the pre-combustion chamber inserts to avoid erroneous readings. (Refer to Figure 3.24).

important.para: REPLACE CYLINDER HEAD IF ANY ONE OF THE INSPECTION CRITERIA DOES NOT MEET SPECIFICATION. CYLINDER HEADS CANNOT BE RESURFACED, BECAUSE REMOVAL OF BOTTOM DECK MATERIAL WILL RESULT IN PISTON TO VALVE CONTACT.
